alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 27 at 3:20AM EST until January 27 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 29 below zero. * WHERE...Northern and central Vermont and northern New York. * WHEN...Through 9 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures as low as 10 to 25 degrees below zero will occur through this morning. Southerly winds in the 10 to 15 mph range will warm temperatures across the area, but combined with below zero temperatures conditions will remain very cold through mid-morning today.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
